meanings.definition: Kurushes (noun): A unit of currency in ancient Persia.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Persia, people used kurushes to buy goods and services.
meanings.sent2: I read in a history book that kurushes were made of silver.
meanings.sent3: The merchant happily accepted the bag of kurushes from the traveler.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled when she saw the pile of kurushes on the table.
meanings.sent5: The sound of kurushes clinking together was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: Despite facing many obstacles, she kurushes to achieve her dreams.
meanings.sent2: He kurushes every day to improve his skills and become better.
meanings.sent3: The little ant kurushes to carry the heavy crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was kurushes against a strong current in the river of life.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete kurushes towards the finish line with all his might.
